title: modify orthogonal init for rows<cols case
body_html:
The suggested behavior, seems to me to make more sense:
"if the number of columns exceeds the number of rows, then the rows are orthonormal vectors; but if the number of rows exceeds the number of columns, then the columns are orthonormal vectors." (from Wikipedia).

If I transition from a linear layer to a larger one, I certainly wouldn't want the weights to be initialized to zeros.

body:
The suggested behavior, seems to me to make more sense:
"if the number of columns exceeds the number of rows, then the rows are orthonormal vectors; but if the number of rows exceeds the number of columns, then the columns are orthonormal vectors." (from [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Semi-orthogonal_matrix)).

If I transition from a linear layer to a larger one, I certainly wouldn't want the weights to be initialized to zeros.
